data.title: Not able to render Code Coverage results in the "Code Coverage" tab in Azure DevOps
data.body:
I have a classic build pipeline in Azure DevOps for that builds and run tests for a .Net Core 3.1 app
I am using self-hosted build agents running Windows Server 2019 OS

Below is the pipeline screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3319134/94642808-9b0fa100-0328-11eb-9b49-54b6b2006742.png)

My tasks:

1. Restore Nuget
2. Build the solution in release mode
3. Install latest vstest.console.exe tool
4. Run tests using above tool and generate .coverage file
5. Install CodeCoverage.exe from Nuget
6. PowerShell script to convert .coverage to .xml
7. Using ReportGenerator task to generate HTML and Cobertura (HTMLInline;HTMLChart;Cobertura)
8. Publish the code coverage results to the server using Cobertura.xml from step 7 and also uploading HTML report folder

**Build runs successfully**
Publish Code Coverage task log
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3319134/94643313-dc548080-0329-11eb-8387-833511f99eec.png)

**Build run summary**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3319134/94643354-f1311400-0329-11eb-9cf8-77c89824a003.png)

**Published files by the build**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3319134/94643472-3b19fa00-032a-11eb-872b-b81c1c8eaa6d.png)

**Code Coverage tab**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3319134/94643390-04dc7a80-032a-11eb-9bfa-8131e5f95b2a.png)

**Issue: The code coverage tab does not display the HTML reports**

## Environment

- Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard
- artifacttool.exe - 2.172
## Issue Description

Universal Package task with ArtifactTool.exe not able to download the package with size more than 40MB. We could able to download the 25MB file using task. When we try to download the 50MB file, ArtifactTool.exe tries 3 attempts and throws error as   "Encountered an unexpected error.","@i":"xxxxxxxxxx","@l":"Error","@x":"System.TimeoutException: ActionBlock`1 was cancelled by something other than the caller (e.g. a timeout) .

data.title: Why is JavaToolInstaller cleaning destination folder when using 'PreInstalled'
data.body:
I tried to use JavaToolInstaller in my pipeline. I put it just after the checkout step:
```
    jobs:
    - job: build
      steps:
      - checkout: self
        fetchDepth: 1
      - task: JavaToolInstaller@0
        inputs:
          versionSpec: '11'
          jdkArchitectureOption: 'x64'
          jdkSourceOption: 'PreInstalled'
```

To my surprise, all checked out source files have been removed. Looking at the logs, I found:
```
Starting: JavaToolInstaller
==============================================================================
Task         : Java tool installer
Description  : Acquire a specific version of Java from a user-supplied Azure blob or the tool cache and sets JAVA_HOME
Version      : 0.175.0
Author       : Microsoft Corporation
Help         : https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/tool/java-tool-installer
==============================================================================
Cleaning destination folder before extraction: /home/vsts/work/1/s
Use preinstalled JDK from /usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-11-hotspot-amd64
JAVA_HOME is being set to: /usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-11-hotspot-amd64
JAVA_HOME_11_x64 is being set to: /usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-11-hotspot-amd64
Prepending PATH environment variable with directory: /usr/lib/jvm/adoptopenjdk-11-hotspot-amd64/bin
Finishing: JavaToolInstaller
```

I'm wondering what is the point to clean the destination folder in this case, especially when it seems to default to the [work dir.](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/414c031e3dc5d51f0f22845caae79cfa07e1c9fc/Tasks/JavaToolInstallerV0/task.json#L114) and it is not even supposed to be set when using `PreInstalled`.

My workaround is to do the checkout after calling JavaToolInstaller, but this will prevent to switch to a different JDK later.

data.title: Feature Request: [Pipeline Caching] Please add control options to run "Post-job: Cache" even if a previous task has failed.
data.body:
## Required Information
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Enter Task Name**: Pipeline Caching

## Issue Description
I encountered a case where I wanted to cache a specified folder, regardless of the success or failure of the pipeline.  
The pnpm package manager caches library packages in the ".pnpm-store" folder.  
Often it fails to download packages, but this does not cause any inconsistencies in the cache folder.  
Cache tasks don't work when the pipeline fails, so there are no fewer packages to download when you run the pipeline again.  

That's why I want to configure the Cache task to work even if the pipeline fails.

data.title: [AzureStack] ICM: Wrong Endpoint URL
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: AzureResourceManagerTemplateDeployment@3

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?

    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 

Account Name: weshi1
Project Name: weshi1
Build ID: 232

https://dev.azure.com/weshi1/weshi1/_build/results?buildId=232&view=logs&j=12f1170f-54f2-53f3-20dd-22fc7dff55f9&t=5af5a3ac-b651-59fe-b478-385ecf6682c0

- Agent - Hosted or Private: 

    - If using private agent, provide the OS of the machine running the agent and the agent version: 

-PublisherName 'MicrosoftWindowsServer' -Offer 'WindowsServer' -Skus '2012-Datacenter' -Version latest

Windows 

## Issue Description

The wrong endpoint URL is being used for AzureStack connection:

https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/abf63ef2b07a3d24b9a950dad5fdff06162b2850/Tasks/Common/azure-arm-rest/azure-arm-endpoint.ts#L81

The endpoint currently used is: 
https://graph.windows.net/metadata/endpoints?api-version=2015-01-01

The correct endpoint looks something like this:
https://management.azure.com/metadata/endpoints?api-version=2015-01-01

It is not supposed to use the graph endpoint.

data.title: DownloadPipelineArtifact uses inconsistent paths
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Maybe Bug

**Enter Task Name**: DownloadPipelineArtifact

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
    
account name : vaughnbutt
team project name : ProjectPOC2
build definition name : YAMLPipelinePOC
build number: buildId=134, #20200929.15

- Agent - Hosted: 
    
agent queue name: umm?

## Issue Description

Summary : The paths used by DownloadPipelineArtifact when the path (aka targetPath) is specified and when it is not specified are inconsistent (I think).

If my analysis is correct then if you execute DownloadPipelineArtifact@2 then the files in the artifact are downloaded to either:
* the directory $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)/\<targetPath\>/ when targetPath is set OR
* the directory $(Pipeline.Workspace) when targetPath is not set

Thus a job with these steps:
```
          - task: DownloadPipelineArtifact@2
            inputs:
              buildType: 'current'
              artifactName: 'myafiles'
          - script: ls -lR $(Pipeline.Workspace)
          - task: DownloadPipelineArtifact@2
            inputs:
              buildType: 'current'
              artifactName: 'myafiles'
              targetPath: mytarget
          - script: ls -lR $(Pipeline.Workspace)
          - script: find $(Pipeline.Workspace) | sed -e "s/[^-][^\/]*\// |/g" -e "s/|\([^ ]\)/|-\1/"
```
results in 
```
ls -lR /home/vsts/work/1
========================== Starting Command Output ===========================
/bin/bash --noprofile --norc /home/vsts/work/_temp/a4cabc49-fbd0-4493-b809-bbd09930fc50.sh
/home/vsts/work/1:
total 20
drwxr-xr-x 2 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 TestResults
drwxr-xr-x 2 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 a
drwxr-xr-x 2 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 b
drwxr-xr-x 2 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 myafiles
-rw-r--r-- 1 vsts docker    0 Sep 29 01:22 myfile-20200929.18
drwxr-xr-x 3 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 s

/home/vsts/work/1/TestResults:
total 0

/home/vsts/work/1/a:
total 0

/home/vsts/work/1/b:
total 0

/home/vsts/work/1/myafiles:
total 0
-rw-r--r-- 1 vsts docker 0 Sep 29 01:22 myfile-20200929.18

/home/vsts/work/1/s:
total 4
drwxr-xr-x 2 vsts docker 4096 Sep 29 01:22 mytarget

/home/vsts/work/1/s/mytarget:
total 0
-rw-r--r-- 1 vsts docker 0 Sep 29 01:22 myfile-20200929.18
```

and
```
find /home/vsts/work/1 | sed -e "s/[^-][^\/]*\// |/g" -e "s/|\([^ ]\)/|-\1/"
========================== Starting Command Output ===========================
/bin/bash --noprofile --norc /home/vsts/work/_temp/e2486638-f9f0-4912-b3bb-49627936a743.sh
 | | |-1
 | | | |-s
 | | | | |-mytarget
 | | | | | |-myfile-20200929.18
 | | | |-myfile-20200929.18
 | | | |-a
 | | | |-b
 | | | |-TestResults
 | | | |-myafiles
 | | | | |-myfile-20200929.18

```
_Note that the directory and file at $(Pipeline.Workspace)/myafiles is the result of the implicit Download Artifact step._

I would have expected that these paths would either both be based at $(Pipeline.Workspace) or both based at $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)


### Task logs

TBD
### Error logs

No errors logged.

When I use task version 4 "Azure Deploy App Service" in Azure DevOps, don't change the option always on for true in blade general setting to application in Portal Azure, but is created the variable alwayson with value true in blade application settings in the portal.

data.title: The Azure SQL DACPAC task failed. SqlPackage.exe exited with code 1
data.body:
Hi All - 

Just getting started with Azure Pipelines and Releases, and trying to get my head wrapped around how to use the Azure SQL DACPAC.  I'm running into an issue with my initial release and I'm unsure as to what the problem is, all I'm getting is the generic **Azure SQL DACPAC task failed.  SqlPackage.exe exitd with code 1** error. data.title: FileTransform task sporadically doesn't apply variable substitutions
data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
Bug

**Enter Task Name**: FileTransform

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Hosted

## Issue Description

The FileTransform task doesn't always appear to substitute variables in the appsettings section of my web.config file. I have pulled out a minimum working demonstration so that this can easily be replicated elsewhere.

The problem _may_ be related to there being dots in the key for the setting we're substituting, but I would expect this to work regardless. It is especially odd that it replaces some of the variables some of the time and isn't consistent in the ones is chooses to replace. I also have a query along similar lines regarding casing.

### Replication
**Create variable group "FileTransformIssue"**

- authentication_domain: DOMAIN_REPLACED
- authentication_password: PASSWORD_REPLACED
- authentication_username: USERNAME_REPLACED
- ControlVariable: True
- isLive: False

azure-pipelines.yaml:
``` yaml
trigger: none

pool:
  vmImage: 'windows-2019'

stages:
- stage: 'Staging'
  variables:
  - group: FileTransformIssue

  jobs:
  - job: 'Transform'
    # IsLive: $(isLive) is NOT included below due to it creating a cyclical reference.
    # However, without it, it is not replaced likely due to the casing difference. Is the
    # FileTransform task case sensitive? In the event we have the same variable key in multiple
    # config files with different casings, can it be made case in-sensitive?
    
    # Mapping variables in which we intend to replace.
    # Many apps depend on this variable group, and they may have different keys.
    # This allows us to define the variable once only in the variable group.
    variables: 
      Authentication.Domain: $(authentication_domain)
      Authentication.Username: $(authentication_username)
      Authentication.Password: $(authentication_password)
    steps:

    - script: |
        echo ControlVariable: $(ControlVariable)
        echo isLive: $(isLive)
        echo authentication_domain: $(authentication_domain)
        echo authentication_username: $(authentication_username)
        echo authentication_password: $(authentication_password)
      displayName: 'Output variables'
    
    - script: type Web.config
      displayName: 'Show Web.config contents before transform'

    - task: FileTransform@1
      displayName: 'Apply variable substitutions'
      inputs:
        folderPath: ''
        fileType: 'xml'
        targetFiles: 'Web.config'
        
    - script: type Web.config
      displayName: 'Show Web.config contents after transform'

```

web.config
``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <appSettings>    
    <add key="ControlVariable" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="IsLive" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Domain" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Username" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Password" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
  </appSettings>
</configuration>
```

### Result
When this runs, the last three variables (Authentication.*) don't always get replaced. Sometimes they do, and sometimes they don't. There doesn't appear to be any consistency to it. I'm unsure if this is due to there being a dot in the original key name, which I believe should be a supported scenario.

**Actual results:**
This is only an example. Sometimes it all displays as expected and other times it only replaces a single authentication key.
``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <appSettings>    
    <add key="ControlVariable" value="True"/>
    <add key="IsLive" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Domain" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Username" value="TO_BE_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Password" value="PASSWORD_REPLACED"/>
  </appSettings>
```

**Expected results:**
``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <appSettings>    
    <add key="ControlVariable" value="True"/>
    <add key="IsLive" value="False"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Domain" value="DOMAIN_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Username" value="USERNAME_REPLACED"/>
    <add key="Authentication.Password" value="PASSWORD_REPLACED"/>
  </appSettings>
</configuration>
```

* Expect Authentication.* keys to be consistently replaced with values from the variable group.
* Expect key name matching not to be case sensitive so IsLive gets replaced.

data.title: HTTP ERROR 404 Not Found in Jenkins Queue Job
data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?** *Type*: Bug ## Environment 1. Azure DevOps 2. Jenkins is hosted Seperatly and we are accessing that using Load Balancer and Token-Based Authentication. ## Issue Description When we try to Trigger Jenkins Job from Azure DevOps Pipeline, Job is getting triggered successfully but Azure DevOps Pipeline is hitting the wrong URL to get the Job ID. Wrong URL which DevOps is hitting - /jenkins/login/queue/item/1711/api/json **Correct URL Must be - /queue/item/1711/api/json** ### Error logs `Jenkins job queued Job progress tracking failed to read job queue HttpResponse.statusCode=404 HttpResponse.statusMessage=Not Found Error 404 Not Found

HTTP ERROR 404 Not Found

URI:/jenkins/login/queue/item/1711/api/json
STATUS:404
MESSAGE:Not Found
SERVLET:Stapler
Powered by Jetty:// 9.4.27.v20200227
##[error]Job progress tracking failed to read job queue Finishing: Queue Jenkins job: DataIntegration_Perl_CodeReviewAutomation ` For Reference and Tracking - https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1202472/http-error-404-not-found-in-jenkins-queue-job.html

data.title: ExtractFiles Task does not work anymore
data.body:
Since yesterday, the ExtractFiles task does not work anymore in my solution. I have not changed anything in my setup, so I guess its due to some updates in the task itself.

I have the following tasks in my pipeline definition yml:
```
 - download: current
   displayName: Download Binaries
   artifact: TestApp
 - task: ExtractFiles@1
   displayName: Unzip Files
   inputs:
     archiveFilePatterns: $(Pipeline.Workspace)/*.zip
     destinationFolder: $(Pipeline.Workspace)/extracted
     cleanDestinationFolder: true
```
My artifact folder is only containing the .zip folder I want to extract:

Please fix.

data.title: azure-pipelines-tasks-azure-arm-rest-v2 - Part Name ".../OpenSSL License.txt" causes tfx create extension build break
data.body:
Question: Consuming "azure-pipelines-tasks-azure-arm-rest-v2" node library causes a build break when using "tfx create extension" to create azure task.

Would anyone know what I can do fix this?

Example:
tfx extension create --root <path>\_build --output-path <path>\_build --manifests <path>\_build\extension-manifest-bld.json --rev-version
TFS Cross Platform Command Line Interface v0.6.4
Copyright Microsoft Corporation
error: Error: Part Name '<path>/node_modules/azure-pipelines-tasks-azure-arm-rest-v2/openssl/OpenSSL License.txt' is invalid. Please check the following:
error: 1. No whitespace or any of these characters: #^[]<>?
error: 2. Cannot end with a period.
error: 3. No percent-encoded / or \ characters. Additionally, % must be followed by two hex characters.

All I did was to add the line
    "azure-pipelines-tasks-azure-arm-rest-v2": "^1.0.4",

to my package.json file and I get the build break from tfx.
Thanks for any advice.

data.title: Environment variable substitution failed in Configuration File (docker-compose.yml)
data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Task Name**: Azure Web App for Containers Deploy

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines, Ubuntu:16.04
- Agent - Hosted or Private:  Hosted
   
## Issue Description
I have a pipeline with 3 tasks in it
**Task 1.** Run a Docker-Compose (Command : Build)
**Task 2.** Run a Docker-Compose (Command : Push)
**Task 3.** Azure Web App on Container Deploy 

**Task 1 & 2** are linked with a docker-compose.prod.yml file that have variables that get substituted from a environment variable group (linked with the pipeline ofcourse)

**Task 3** in which I have linked the following Configuration File (to be updated/deployed on my multicontainers web service) :- 

**Contents of Configuration File** 
```
version: '3.7'

services:
  web:
    command: python3 manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8000
    image: "${AZ_CONTAINER_REGISTRY}/${APP1_IMAGE}:${APP1_VERSION}"
    ports:
      - 8000:8000
  app2:
    command: python app.py
    image: "${AZ_CONTAINER_REGISTRY}/${APP2_IMAGE}:${APP2_VERSION}"
    expose:
      - 8080
    restart: always
```

However, in Task 3 the variables DO NOT get substituted when the Task is performed. Task updates my multicontainer web service config as it is as shown above.

What confuses me that Task 1 and Task 2 are successfully performed i.e. the yml files linked to those DO get variables substituted from same variable group but Task 3 fail to do so before deploying it to web service.

Important to note that:
* All Variables (AZ_CONTAINER_REGISTRY, APP1_IMAGE, APP1_VERSION, APP2_IMAGE, APP2_VERSION) are NOT secret.

data.title: Feature Request: Support Multiple Database Targets in Task SQL Database Deployment

labels.name: environment:triage
labels.description: Issues need to be triage by environment-deployment team

data.body:
This task works great for deploying to a single database.  It would be even more awesome if it could be enhanced to support deploying the same dacpac to multiple databases.  

I understand we could do this now using "Each" loops in YAML or a custom PS task but it would be great if this pre-built task could accept a comma delimited list of DB names - limiting the functionality to deploying to multiple targets on the same server.

Thanks for considering.

data.title: nuget install task should work with any version

data.title: Helm v3 ACR login
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*:  FEATURE

**Enter Task Name**:  `Package and deploy Helm charts`

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?

Azure Pipelines
    
- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    
Private.  Redhat 7.5

## Issue Description

Using Helm 3, it does not seem possible to run a `helm registry login` command in order to login to Azure Container Registry.  The error we get is:

```
2020-09-23T19:30:09.6325304Z [command]/builds/agent1/_tool/helm/3.3.0/x64/linux-amd64/helm registry login $(server) -u $(user) -p $(password)
2020-09-23T19:30:09.6407913Z ##[error]Error: unknown command "registry login" for "helm"
```

HELM_EXPERIMENTAL_OCI=1 is being set.

I see this:  https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/pull/13005

But don't see it as an available task option?

Are we not allowed to use ACR as a chart store for Helm charts?

data.title: Critical fix on action description
data.body:
How many folder permissions has this thing ruined already? 

The description is now "Clean destination folder..." while it is actually deleteing and re-creating the folder! Folder permissions is a thing, so the description should be changed as a quick fix.

**Task name**: ExtractFilesV1

**Description**: Critical fix on action description

data.title: Bash@3 doesn't have permissions to execute NuGet.exe installed by agent
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: Bash@3

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?
    
    - If using TFS on-premises, provide the version: Azure DevOps Server Version Dev17.M153.5
    
    - ~~If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number:~~


- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    
    - ~~If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name:-~~

    - If using private agent, provide the OS of the machine running the agent and the agent version: Ubuntu 16.04/2.153.1

## Issue Description

Bash inline script doesn't have execution rights on NuGet.exe installed by `NuGetToolInstaller@1`

I feel like this deserves some background: Only reason for going the bash-route is because I need to pass `-Suffix` conditionally to nuget. data.title: AzureResourceGroupDeploymentV2 - Escaping [ results in [[ after deployment.
data.body:
## Note  
Deploying an ARM template using this extension gives a different result than deploying the ARM template using Powershell or [Azure Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template). 

Using this task, when I am deploying a parameter of type **string** with the following value **[[someValue]**,  the value is deployed as **[[someValue]**, however, if I use the same ARM template in Powershell or Azure Portal, the result is deployed as **[someValue]** (the ARM escape character is honored).

I think there's an issue in the extension when deploying values that are escaping the [ character for ARM expressions.

data.title: FileTransform correctly applies all transforms but still reports Error Unable to apply transformation for the given package - Changes are already present in the package.
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: bug

**Enter Task Name**: FileTransform

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 
      - Account: PromontoryNetwork
      - TeamProject: newco.com
      - Definition: 2
      - Build Number: 0.2.18

- Agent - Hosted or Private: 

    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name: **windows-latest**


## Issue Description

I have a multi-stage YAML pipeline, that has the following Filesystem Transform task defined in a Deployment Job:

```
- task: FileTransform@2
  displayName: 'Apply Release Transforms'
  inputs:
    folderPath: '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)\$(artifactName)\deploy\'
    enableXmlTransform: true
    xmlTransformationRules: |
      -transform *.Release.config -xml *.config
      -transform *.$(Environment.Name).config -xml *.config
      -transform config\**\*.Release.config -xml config\**\*.config
      -transform config\**\*.$(Environment.Name).config -xml config\**\*.config
    xmlTargetFiles: |
      web.config
```

We have two configuration files in the root of the application that need at least the Release transform applied (web.config and ApplicationInsights.config) as well as optional environment transforms.
Similarly there are a number of .config files in the config folder, that have optional release and environment transforms.

Looking at the logs and the transformed files, all transforms are being correctly applied to the target files, but we are still getting the following error reported from the task (note that this is not stopping the deployment, but it is creating noise in the reports that makes it look like an error has occurred):

```
##[error]Unable to apply transformation for the given package - Changes are already present in the package.
```

### Task logs

[23.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/files/5261355/23.txt)


## Troubleshooting
Checkout how to troubleshoot failures and collect debug logs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/troubleshooting

### Error logs

```
##[error]Unable to apply transformation for the given package - Changes are already present in the package.
```

data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: Azure App Service deploy, version 4

Probably this:

https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/AzureRmWebAppDeploymentV4

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Hosted 
    
## Issue Description

We have `appsettings.json` like this:

```json
{
  "Common": {
    "Foo": {
      "Bar": {
        "Zoo": "REPLACEMENT_SHOULD_WORK_BUT_DOESNT"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Then we have a var in Release defintion like this:

```
Common.Foo.Bar.Zoo = "some value"
```

When we run web app deploy, this value is not replaced.

When we change `Common` to something else, e.g. `TestCommon`, everything works. Must be something special about this `Common`.

---

EDIT: the docs here don't say anything about any special names like this. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/transforms-variable-substitution?view=azure-devops&tabs=Classic

data.title: AzureCLI@2 task running az webapp create-remote-connection hangs ubuntu agent due to child processes not terminating
data.body:
## Required Information

**Type**: Bug or Feature (?)

**Task Name**: AzureCLI@2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Hosted - ubuntu

## Issue Description

AzureCLI@2 and `az webapp create-remote-connection`
 
There appears to be pitfalls in attempting to establish the SSH SCM bridge connection in context of an Azure CLI agent task with obvious solutions not forthcoming.

`az webapp create-remote-connection` in `bash` with either `&` (background task) or in `pwsh/pscore` `Start-Process` will just hang the task waiting for child processes to exit - and unless you're familiar with the agent's underlying process model, you're in for a nightmare ride.

It is not obvious to me how `az webapp ssh` is best used as it doesn't appear to behave the same as just `ssh`. I imagine it is just for opening an interactive shell session ([`webapp ssh`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/webapp?view=azure-cli-latest#az_webapp_ssh)) and the other is just for a background tcp tunnel ([`webapp create-remote-connection`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/webapp?view=azure-cli-latest#az_webapp_create_remote_connection)). 

> Note: Not to be confused with [`remote-connection create`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/ext/webapp/webapp/remote-connection?view=azure-cli-latest) which also lurks in the 'extension reference' documentation.

This is primarily a usability concern - if attempting SSH connections using this tool and with this task (which is reasonable given its purpose), the resulting processes spawned `az` does not appear to sit well with how the task is managing its process groups on the agent. 

Without using `setsid`, or `pgrep`ing for, in this instance, "webapp", you cannot reliably terminate all the spawned processes. The spawned process which hangs the agent appears to possibly be `python3`.

Such issues could be circumvented if, say, [Add task to run bash scripts on App Service slots](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/11441) were adopted.

Is it the responsibility of this task to better manage the parent process group, such that it doesn't hang the agent on finalizing the task? 

Is there a recommended approach worth documenting for working with these types of commands in the context of `AzureCLI@2` ? 

Could this task be improved with some task options regarding the process model?

## Troubleshooting
I used the following inline bash script to troubleshoot what was going on, after the calls to `az webapp create-remote-connection`, to query _what jobs and processes were actually running_ at various stages, with the intention of running just a dummy `helloworld.sh` on a target app service (being a custom docker container that has had [SSH enabled as per documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/configure-custom-container#enable-ssh), and that it has a custom ssh `id_agent.pub` key in its list of `authorized_keys` for `root`, to enable _passwordless_ ssh scripting):

```
shopt
echo Initial processes
ps ax --forest -O pgid,tpgid
curl https://___appservicename___.azurewebsites.net/robots123345.txt
chmod 600 deploy/docker/id_agent
setsid sh -c "az webapp create-remote-connection -n ___appservicename___ -g ___resourcegroup___ -p 2222" &
sleep 30s
mkdir ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh
ssh-keyscan -4 -p 2222 -t rsa localhost >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
chmod 644 ~/.ssh/known_hosts
ssh -T -l root -i deploy/docker/id_agent -p 2222 localhost < deploy/scripts/helloworld.sh
echo Before killing all webapp processes
ps ax --forest -O pgid,tpgid
jobs
jobs -p
kill -- -$(jobs -p)
sleep 10s
echo After kill by PGID webapp processes
ps ax --forest -O pgid,tpgid
jobs
jobs -p
```

## Workaround

Execute the command **`kill -- -$(jobs -p)`** which `SIGTERM`s the processes in the process group of the started background job. 

I also had success with `kill $(pgrep -f webapp)` before I analyzed the process group behaviour and decided to call instead `setsid`. This seems to be the best solution for Powershell Core also as I could not find cmdlets that dealt with process groups.

Others have worked around using [`expect`](https://github.com/projectkudu/kudu/issues/3041#issuecomment-559796949).

### Error logs

I hope these error logs may help people trace similar issues they may suffer.

Without the workaround, the task would be stuck at 100%, and never finishing, with the final log entry of note being being either: 

```
The STDIO streams did not close within 10 seconds of the exit event from process '/usr/bin/pwsh'. This may indicate a child process inherited the STDIO streams and has not yet exited.
```

``` 
The STDIO streams did not close within 10 seconds of the exit event from process '/bin/bash'. This may indicate a child process inherited the STDIO streams and has not yet exited.
```

### Task logs

Here is the agent's process stack at various stages:

### Before `create-remote-connection`:
```
   PID   PGID  TPGID S TTY          TIME COMMAND
....
  1407   1407     -1 S ?        00:00:01 /opt/vsts/provisioner/provisioner
  2802   1407     -1 S ?        00:00:02  \_ /home/vsts/agents/2.174.1/bin/Agent.Listener run
  2843   1407     -1 S ?        00:00:04      \_ /home/vsts/agents/2.174.1/bin/Agent.Worker spawnclient 116 119
  3400   1407     -1 S ?        00:00:00          \_ /home/vsts/agents/2.174.1/externals/node/bin/node /home/vsts/work/_tasks/AzureCLI_46e4be58-730b-4389-8a2f-ea10b3e5e815/2.0.16/azureclitask.js
  3460   1407     -1 S ?        00:00:00              \_ /bin/bash /home/vsts/work/_temp/azureclitaskscript1600125574374.sh

```

labels.name: aa-backlog

data.body:
Hello,

since 1st of September 2020 we are facing nuget push upload error on every try in certain package in our on-premise agent which is pushing/uploading to Azure DevOps services project feed.

Most of our packages are quite light with few depencies and always have worked fine the nuget feed updating.

data.title: IIS Web App Manage (On machine group) | Adding bindings should be a graceful operation
data.body:
**WHEN** choosing the "Add binding" option in a "IIS web app manage" task
**IF** you have a binding that requires a certificate (https) and you have a thumbprint provided
**THEN** the first initial deployment will succeed
**THEN** all the consecutive ones will fail on the part where netsh is called in a similar manner:
`"netsh" http add sslcert ipport=0.0.0.0:443 certhash=*** appid={a78bae04-5ec5-4fc4-a879-c9fd8ba3ddb0} certstorename=MY`
**BECAUSE** the binding with the given certificate already exists

So currently you have to no if you are deploying a binding initially or not, and customize the deployment and only turn on/enable the add bindings part for the initial one or else it will fail.

I think it would be proper if given the error message _SSL Certificate add failed, Error: 183
Cannot create a file when that file already exists._ we shouldn't fail the task, and continue adding missing bindings if any or with execution of next task, but currently this fails a deployment.

data.title: DockerV2: Task ignores addPipelineData and always sets two labels on build
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: DockerV2 
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/DockerV2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
    
- Agent - Hosted: 
    
    - Image: ubuntu-18.04
    - Pool: Azure Pipelines

## Issue Description

[Include task name(s), screenshots and any other relevant details]

By default the Docker Task (build/push/build and push) sets pipeline metadata as labels. This can be deactivated by setting **addPipelineData: false** in the pipelines.yml definition.

Unfortunately, even after deactivating this explicitly, two labels remain present in the build result. The labels in question are `build.sourceversion` and `teamfoundationcollectionuri`. While I don't have a problem with the former, the name and address of the Project Collection is not something I would like to pass around as public data. 

Right now there dont seem to be any way to remove these labels other than executing another docker build via the CLI and overwriting/erasing the _unwanted_ labels.

Pipeline metadata is disabled: 

``` yaml
- task: Docker@2
displayName: 'build docker image'
inputs:
  command: build
  Dockerfile: $(workdir)/src/web/Dockerfile
  buildContext: $(workdir)/src/web
  addPipelineData: false
```

The resulting image metadata contains these two labels:
```
LABEL com.azure.dev.image.build.sourceversion=....
LABEL com.azure.dev.image.system.teamfoundationcollectionuri=https://dev.azure.com/.../
```

The issue is that the pipeline task ignores the value of `addPipelineData`.

Offending line (for `teamfoundationcollectionuri`):
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/714e68f75c1e56ca699f6514700c5824cd231079/Tasks/Common/docker-common-v2/pipelineutils.ts#L23

The task also sets the build.sourceversion label. This is done in [pipelineutils.ts line #31](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/714e68f75c1e56ca699f6514700c5824cd231079/Tasks/Common/docker-common-v2/pipelineutils.ts#L31)


### Task logs

```
Step 16/17 : LABEL com.azure.dev.image.build.sourceversion=e75b414***************0fdef0388ce7550e
 ---> Running in c557bf5ded0a
Removing intermediate container c557bf5ded0a
 ---> 38ee50360568
Step 17/17 : LABEL com.azure.dev.image.system.teamfoundationcollectionuri=https://dev.azure.com/<Project_Collection_Name>/
```

### Expected behavior

I expect that the Task respects my choice and disabling pipeline metadata actually disables pipeline metadata.

data.title: Command-line task reports false success if STDIO left open
data.body:
_Originally posted by @glucaci in https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/11334#issuecomment-583333300_

I've created new issue because nobody answers on closed one.
Below is the content of the original post:

### Original:
Lately we have the same problem with a .NET Core Task. I reported this also in https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-image-generation/issues/1386 because I'm not sure where this fits.
```
Starting: dotnet tool restore
==============================================================================
Task         : .NET Core
Description  : Build, test, package, or publish a dotnet application, or run a custom dotnet command
Version      : 2.164.0
Author       : Microsoft Corporation
Help         : https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/build/dotnet-core-cli
==============================================================================
/opt/hostedtoolcache/dotnet/dotnet tool restore --ignore-failed-sources --no-cache --verbosity normal

... restoring packages

Restore was successful.
The STDIO streams did not close within 10 seconds of the exit event from process '/opt/hostedtoolcache/dotnet/dotnet'. This may indicate a child process inherited the STDIO streams and has not yet exited.
```
and the task will remain blocked until build timeout expires.

### Update:
Also with Task Version 2.169.1

#### Workaround:
Enable ```Continue on error``` and set ```Timeout``` on 1 min

data.title: Allow overriding existing files in ExtractFiles task.
data.body:
This change adds an optional input to override existing files when using the ExtractFiles task. The input will default to true as that is likely what the user wants. This will change the default behavior of the task.

[Related PR 1](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/pull/6760)
[Related PR 2](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/pull/11594)
[Related Issue 1](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/11082)
[Related Issue 2](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/11593)

data.title: App Center iOS Test Run fails: Unable to find test runner app
data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Question

**Enter Task Name**: Xcode & App Center Test 

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines 
- If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 

Account Name: ishmeet@simplifiedautomation.ca / Simplified Automation Inc.
Team Project Name: PET Mobile
Build Definition Name: PR Build - 2 / #20200503.20

- Agent - Hosted or Private: Hosted
    
    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name: macOS-10.15

## Issue Description
I have a Xcode build and test task. I created the Xcode build-for-testing task as recommended [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/test-cloud/vsts-plugin#xcuitest) with Arguments `-derivedDataPath DerivedData` in Advanced section. 

![Screen Shot 2020-05-03 at 10 26 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17765279/80920384-2b9f8080-8d8d-11ea-9f4d-9c17e0ff3130.png)

And in Prepare Tests section in App Center Test Task I have set the Build directory, again, as shown in the above URL. 
![Screen Shot 2020-05-03 at 10 27 49 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17765279/80920408-538ee400-8d8d-11ea-88cb-08fdb7004d64.png)

When I run this task, I get the following error:
```
 Unable to find test runner app within /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/DerivedData/Build/Products/Debug-iphoneos/
```

### Task logs
[App center Log.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/files/4570998/App.center.Log.txt)
[Xcode Build Log.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/files/4570999/Xcode.Build.Log.txt)

Checkout how to troubleshoot failures and collect debug logs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/troubleshooting

data.title: DotNetCoreCLIV2:Restore - User level NuGet.config not loaded
data.body:
## Required Information
*Type*: bug 
**Enter Task Name**: DotNetCoreCLIV2 (v2.131.0)

## Environment
- Server -  TFS on-premises 2018.U2
- Agent - Private: 
  - Agent.OS | Windows_NT (Server 2012R2)
  - Agent.OSVersion | 6.3.9600
  - Agent.Version | 2.131.0

## Issue Description
Using `Destination directory` aka `--packages` cmdline option break user Nuget.config loading. 
Our agent run under a service account with an Nuget.config in `%appdata%\NuGet\NuGet.Config` containing multiple packageSources + packageSourceCredentials + apiKey. Projects don't have any project-level settings. 

When settings the `Destination directory`, with an empty temp. nuget config, the nuget config. don't get loaded at first sight. 

When removing this settings, it works.

### Task logs
#### When using  `Destination directory`
[logs_TargetBuildDirectory-EmptySelectedFeed.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/files/4484920/logs_TargetBuildDirectory-EmptySelectedFeed.zip)
#### When not using `Destination directory`
[logs_NoTargetBuildDirectory-EmptySelectedFeed.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/files/4484921/logs_NoTargetBuildDirectory-EmptySelectedFeed.zip)

data.title: Xcode@5 Code Signing Error when building a project with embedded framework that does not support manual signing
data.body:
## Required Information

*Type*: Bug
**Task Name**: Xcode@5  

## Environment

All

## Issue Description

`Xcode@5` fails to build an Xcode project that has multiple targets that have mixed signing needs, resulting in a Code Signing Error with this format:

```
<Framework> does not support provisioning profiles. <Framework> does not support provisioning profiles, but provisioning profile <Provisioning Profile Name> has been manually specified. Set the provisioning profile value to "Automatic" in the build settings editor.
```

In my case, I am trying to build an Xcode project produced by Unity 2019.3, which includes a new `UnityFramework` that does not support manual code signing.

According to the [Unity Documentation](https://docs.unity3d.com/2019.3/Documentation/Manual/StructureOfXcodeProject.html), a new set of command line arguments for `xcodebuild` are to be used to target manual code signing to the main `Unity-iPhone` target only, and leave `UnityFramework` to be able to signed automatically.

Using `PROVISIONING_PROFILE_APP` and `PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER_APP` instead of `PROVISIONING_PROFILE` and `PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER` in the `xcodebuild` command fixes this issue.

Adding a "Custom Provisioning Profile Argument Suffix" parameter to `Xcode` under the Signing action would allow this issue to be fixed. See [this blob post](https://lyricsboy.github.io/2016/11/30/xcode-8-automatic-signing-ci/) for more information about how the suffixes are used in building Xcode projects with multiple targets.

Here is a Unity produced Xcode project that can be used to demonstrate the issue:

https://content-infrastructure-uploadbucket-iuhbmg0o97e6.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/AzureXcodeCodeSignError.zip

You can attempt to build it using a command similar to this:

```
/usr/bin/xcodebuild -sdk iphoneos13.2 -configuration Release -project ./Unity-iPhone.xcodeproj -scheme Unity-iPhone archive CODE_SIGN_STYLE=Manual CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY="<Code Sign Identity>" PROVISIONING_PROFILE_APP="<Provisioning Profile UUID>" PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER_APP="<Provisioning Profile Name>"
```

data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Enter Task Name**: SqlDacpacDeploymentOnMachineGroup

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Private

## Issue Description
When using pattern matching to find the SQL file to deploy, an error is raised when there is more than 1 one: `Found more than one file to deploy with search pattern **/*.sql. There can be only one.`. But it is possible to execute multiple SQL files _without_ pattern matching, by separating them with a ; as in `file1.sql;file2.sql`.

Please add to ability to have multiple sql files deployed when using pattern matching.

See also https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/10195#issuecomment-493855770

*Type*: Bug

> Team project name: Platform
> Build definition name: Utilities.ResourceNameBuilder
> Build number: 20190810.5


- Agent - Hosted or Private:  Hosted

Agent queue name: Hosted Agent


## Issue Description
Task display name: "Nuget package pack"

Here is the YAML I'm using:
```
- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  displayName: "Nuget package pack"
  inputs:
    command: 'pack'
    packagesToPack: '**/Utilities.ResourceNameBuilder.csproj'
    includesymbols: true
    versioningScheme: 'byPrereleaseNumber'
    majorVersion: '1'
    minorVersion: '0'
    patchVersion: '0'

- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  displayName: 'Nuget package push'
  inputs:
    command: 'push'
    packagesToPush: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/*.nupkg'
    nuGetFeedType: 'internal'
    publishVstsFeed: 'xyz'
```

I'm aiming to include the symbols and only publish the one project (specifically stated since I also have a unit test project in the solution).

I'm showing that there are two pushes performed: one for the packed target and one for the symbols. If I run this via the NuGetCommand@2, my YAML looks like the following:

```
- task: NuGetCommand@2

    command: 'pack'
    packagesToPack: '**/Utilities.ResourceNameBuilder.csproj'
    versioningScheme: 'byPrereleaseNumber'
    majorVersion: '1'
    minorVersion: '0'
    patchVersion: '0'
    includeSymbols: true
```

data.title: Publish Test Result: JUnit result with multiple test suites not displayed properly
data.body:
Hi there,

we're encountering problems using the "Publish test results" tasks under following environment:

- TFS on-premises: 15.117.27024.0
- Private Agent: 2.122.1 running on Windows 7 

The test results file (JUnit) contains multiple testsuite elements, which again can contain multiple test cases. The publishing runs without exception. But the "Tests" overview does not group the results by testsuite. Instead it produces a single "parent node", which contains all testcases of all testsuites.

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<testsuites xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
   <testsuite name="Testsuite1" tests="2" failures="2" errors="0" time="0" timestamp="2018-07-06T14:27:44.3258474+02:00" id="0">   
		<testcase name="Case1" time="0">
			<failure>Fail1</failure>
		</testcase>
		<testcase name="Case2" time="0">
			<failure>Fail2</failure>
		</testcase>	
	</testsuite>
	<testsuite name="Testsuite2" tests="2" failures="2" errors="0" time="0" timestamp="2018-07-06T14:27:44.3258474+02:00" id="1">
		<testcase name="Case1" time="0">
			<failure>Fail1</failure>
		</testcase>
		<testcase name="Case2" time="0">
			<failure>Fail2</failure>
		</testcase>	
	</testsuite>
</testsuites>`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32731353/42436694-1d3ce5b6-835b-11e8-8809-4c68bdfdefd9.png)

The image shows the single parent named "Unspecified". I would expect two test suites (Testsuite1 and Testsuite2).

Greetings
